keyEvents.description: Hiriluk arrives at Drum Castle, only to discover Wapol's trap
Dr. Hiriluk delivers his iconic death speech and detonates himself at the castle
Wapol arrives at the base of the castle in the present timeline, preparing to reclaim it

description: The royal castle of Drum Island, located atop a massive drum-shaped mountain. It serves as the seat of power for the kingdom and was the site of Dr. Hiriluk's tragic final moments.
significance: Drum Castle is the location of one of One Piece's most emotionally powerful scenes - Dr. Hiriluk's death and his speech about inherited will. The castle represents both the tyranny of Wapol's rule and the hope for change.

geographicalDetails.climate: Winter Island - perpetual snow and cold

keyEvents.description: Chopper searches for and retrieves the Amiudake mushroom on Drum Island
Chopper runs through the snowy landscape trying to reach Drum Castle to save Hiriluk

description: A winter island in the Grand Line with perpetual snow and freezing temperatures. The island is known for its medical expertise but suffered under the cruel rule of King Wapol.
significance: Drum Island is the setting for Chopper's tragic backstory and serves as the location where he learned about medicine, loss, and the meaning of inherited will. The island would later be renamed the Sakura Kingdom in honor of Dr. Hiriluk's dream.
